name: Low-Dose Doxepin (Silenor)
summary: A low-dose tricyclic antidepressant formulation used specifically for the treatment of sleep maintenance insomnia.
description: Low-dose doxepin is a selective histamine H1 receptor antagonist at these doses, with minimal antidepressant or anticholinergic effects. Marketed under the brand name Silenor, it is indicated for sleep maintenance insomnia in adults. Unlike higher doses of doxepin used for depression and anxiety, low-dose doxepin primarily works as a sedative without significant effects on norepinephrine or serotonin reuptake.

off_label_uses: Insomnia associated with depression or anxiety
contraindications: Concurrent use of MAOIs or within 14 days
Hypersensitivity to doxepin or other TCAs

sections.text: At low doses (≤6 mg), doxepin selectively antagonizes central histamine H1 receptors, promoting sleep maintenance with minimal anticholinergic or adrenergic effects.

adult.insomnia: 3–6 mg once nightly within 30 minutes of bedtime

sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; consider lower starting dose

sections.text: Onset: within 30–60 minutes; Duration: up to 7–8 hours.

sections.black_box: Antidepressants increase the risk of suicidal thinking and behavior in children, adolescents, and young adults. Although risk is minimal at low doses, caution is advised.
other: Avoid alcohol and other CNS depressants
Not recommended for early insomnia (sleep onset)
May cause next-day drowsiness in sensitive individuals

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; use with caution
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity; start with lowest dose

sections.text: Not usually required for doses ≤6 mg, but gradual discontinuation can be considered if used for extended periods.

items: Minimal next-day impairment compared to many other hypnotics
Primarily improves sleep maintenance rather than sleep onset
Has less abuse potential than benzodiazepines or Z-drugs
